data.text:
Location: The Inflatable Museum, in your school hall

Aimed at: Key Stage 2

Timing: 75 minutes

Extra/curricular Links: Science – Classification; Uses and implications of science

Classes per day: We can work with up 2 classes per day (3 if you do not need the school hall at lunchtime)

Availability: Wednesdays and Thursdays in term time

Your workshop

Using our taxidermy handling collection in the Inflatable Museum, this workshop explores different ways of approaching classifying and grouping creatures from around the world.

Through interactive challenges and the lens of how museum displays are created, pupils will:

Practice classifying and grouping different animals and insects according to their own observations and knowledge

Put themselves in other people’s shoes explore different perspectives on nature

Curate their own museum natural history display

Through these activities, we aim for pupils to recognise that many alternative ways of grouping and classifying are potentially valuable and interesting – including the standard ‘scientific’ approach. This workshop has been developed as part of our work to bring global Indigenous perspectives to our collection.

What it costs

– For 1 class in a day: £250

– For 2 classes in a day: £380 total

– For 3 classes in a day: £500 total

(Please see our practical information for details of how many classes we can accommodate per day. You might like to invite neighbouring schools to join you for the day to keep your costs down.)

Discounts for 2022-3: We are pleased to offer a 30% discount for all state-funded schools in the following postcodes neighbouring the Museum: M1, M2, M3, M4, M11, M12, M13, M14, M15, M16, M18, and M19

How to book

Please make sure you’ve read the practical information about the Inflatable Museum first, and then click the link below to make your booking enquiry. We always aim to get back to you within 5 working days (term-time).

Make an Inflatable Museum booking enquiry

For any other queries, please contact school.bookings@manchester.ac.uk.
